questionnaire_description: Taking into account the description and aim of the exercise and observing the repetition, answer the questions by assigning the number associated with the answer

exercise_stages.stage_1: The subject holds the arms parallel, at an angle of ninety degrees with respect to the torso (arms aligned with the shoulders) with the elbows completely extended.
exercise_stages.stage_2: The subject then rotates the torso slowly first to the left and afterwards to the right.
exercise_stages.stage_3: After rotation to the right, the subject returns to the starting position.

body segment terminology.horizontal elbow distance: The horizontal distance between the elbows
body segment terminology.elbow extension angle: angle between the upper arm and forearm for each arm
body segment terminology.shoulder extension angle: angle between the shoulder and upper arm for each arm
body segment terminology.knee extension angle: angle between the thigh and the calf for each leg
body segment terminology.wrist raise distance: vertical distance bettwen the wrist and the shoulder for each arm
body segment terminology.hip angle: angle between the thigh and the torso in the frontal plane for each leg
body segment terminology.hip depth shift: up and down translation of the hip

PO_questions.x: Is the horizontal elbow distance maximized when the arms are rotated to the left?
PO_questions.y: Is the horizontal elbow distance maximized when the arms are rotated to the right?
PO_questions.1: Are the metrics in the above 2 questions achieved in the exercise?
PO_questions.2: Is the exercise carried out in a constant manner throughout? Is rise time equal to fall time?
PO_questions.3: Is the amplitude of the movement complete in the exercise? Is the amplitude maximized at the middle frame?

CF_questions._comment: # Default answer for questions a to h should be 3. DO NOT include this field in the result.
CF_questions.a: Is the shoulder distance constant in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.b: Is the shoulder extension angles symmetrical and constant across both arms in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.c: Are the elbow extension angles symmetrical and constant across both arms in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.d: Are the knee extension angles symmetrical and constant across both legs in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.e: Are the hip angles symmetrical and constant across both legs in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.f: Are the hip distance constant in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.g: Are the feet on the ground, slightly apart, with the knees slightly flexed in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.h: Is the subject free of ANY forward or backward bending of the trunk?
CF_questions.i: Is the subject free of ANY pelvis shift in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.j: Is the body aligned to the vertical axis in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.k: Is the subjest free of ANY hip depth shift in all 5 frames?
CF_questions.4: Based on your answer for a and b, is the posture of the head correct?
CF_questions.5: Based on your answer for b, c, and j, is the posture of the right arm correct?
CF_questions.6: Based on your answer for b, c, and j, is the posture of the left arm correct?
CF_questions.7: Based on your answer for e, h, and i, is the posture of the trunk correct?
CF_questions.8: Based on your answer for f, h, and i, is the posture of the pelvis correct?
CF_questions.9: Based on your answer for d, g, and k, is the posture of the right leg correct?
CF_questions.10: Based on your answer for d, g, and k, is the posture of the left leg correct?
